title: Stranger Things star Maya Hawke, 21, bares almost all in jokey naked tour of LA studio on Instagram
text:
She's a rising star thanks to her winning performance as newcomer Robin in season 3 of Netflix's Stranger Things.

And Maya Hawke, daughter of Uma Thurman and Ethan Hake, is determined to enjoy her new higher profile.

On Monday, the 21-year-old gave her Instagram followers a tour of Loyal Studios in LA and added a twist; she did it almost naked.

Daring: Maya Hawke gave her Instagram followers a tour of Loyal Studios in LA in an Instagram video she posted Monday and added a twist; she did it almost naked

Maya was seen in the short video clip holding a blue blazer over her front and holding it together with one hand at the back, covering her butt.

She barely protected her modesty as she walked along the hallway to a makeup room holding a plastic bottle of water in her other hand.

The giggling actress was daubed with glitter on her face, shoulders and upper chest.

Nearly nude: The bubbly 21-year-old was seen in the short clip holding a blue blazer over her front and with glitter on her face, shoulders and upper chest

Skimpy: Maya barely protected her modesty as she walked along a hallway. She held the blazer together with one hand at the back, while carrying a plastic bottle of water in her other hand

'If you were ever wondering what it was like to be famous, this is it,' she said in her jokey commentary.

'It’s very glamorous and sexy and everybody wants to sleep with you and kiss you all the time. People give you lots of free food and free clothes and free alcohol. I basically I just never pay for a thing.'

She then took a swig of water before admitting she was drunk.

Sarcastic: 'If you were ever wondering what it was like to be famous, this is it,' she said in her jokey commentary. 'It’s very glamorous and sexy and everybody wants to sleep with you'

Tipsy: The daughter of Uma Thurman and Ethan Hawke concluded the video by confessing that she was drunk

Post Stranger Things, Maya stars in the drama Human Capital with Marisa Tomei, Peter Sarsgaard and Liev Schreiber.

The drama had its premiere at the Toronto International Film Festival in September.

She's also wrapped filming on Mainstream, a film directed by Gia Coppola and co-starring Andrew Garfield.
